p: Nickel oxide nanoparticales (NiO NPs) have attracted increasing attention owing to potential use in a variety of applications such as catalysts, solar cells, light-emitting diodes, lithium-ion batteries, resistive random access memory, electrochemical sensors and biosensors [ 9]. Therefore, increasing use of NiO NPs necessitates an improved understanding of their potential impact on the environment and human health. Besides, toxic effects of NiO NPs have been investigated in different human cell systems, mainly on liver and airway cells [ 10].
